sentences.sentence: The leaders of Italy's right-wing coalition held their closing rally in Rome, three days ahead of an election they hoped to win.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Thousands of supporters gathered to see Silvio Berlusconi, Matteo Salvini and Giorgia Maloney, who could become the first post-fascist leader of a founding EU member state.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Euronews correspondent Giorgia Orlandi reports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Right-wing political leaders have gathered here in Rome for the final push to convince undecided voters, but also to greet the many supporters who have met here under tight security measures and judging by the large crowd it seems that they have been warmly welcomed by their supporters there's a lot of optimism in the air that's perhaps because the rowing coalition was leading the polls before a polling embargo kicked in only two weeks before Election Day in this very square on Friday the left-wing coalition will be gathering here for its final rally and it seems that the challenge really lies in the numbers and it's all about how many supporters the two opposite coalitions will manage to drag over here. And we'll find out after Sunday whether or not this is going to be an indication of who's going to be the winner of these elections. George Orlandi for Euronews in Rome. A moment of silence was observed in Australia's Parliament House to honour former Queen Elizabeth II.
